intro: Sobralia atropubescens, commonly known as the dark-hairy sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit and possesses lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in rare orchids.
